# Environment Setup & Configuration

## Overview

This skill provides comprehensive guidance on setting up reproducible development environments, managing dotfiles, configuring dev containers, and creating consistent workspace configurations across teams and machines. It covers modern best practices for environment management, tool configuration, and developer experience optimization.

## Activation

Use this skill when:
- Setting up a new development machine
- Creating reproducible development environments
- Managing dotfiles and configuration files
- Setting up dev containers or Docker development environments
- Configuring VS Code, IDEs, or editors
- Creating team-wide development standards
- Onboarding new developers
- Synchronizing settings across multiple machines

## Instructions

#### 2. Installation Script

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# install.sh - Automated dotfiles installation

set -euo pipefail

DOTFILES_DIR="$HOME/.dotfiles"
BACKUP_DIR="$HOME/.dotfiles_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"

log() {
  echo "[$(date +'%H:%M:%S')] $*"
}

backup_existing() {
  local file=$1
  if [[ -f "$HOME/$file" ]] || [[ -L "$HOME/$file" ]]; then
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"
    mv "$HOME/$file" "$BACKUP_DIR/"
    log "Backed up existing $file"
  fi
}

link_dotfile() {
  local src=$1
  local dest=$2
  
  backup_existing "$(basename "$dest")"
  
  mkdir -p "$(dirname "$dest")"
  ln -sf "$src" "$dest"
  log "Linked $src -> $dest"
}

install_dotfiles() {
  log "Installing dotfiles..."
  
  # Shell configurations
  link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/.bashrc" "$HOME/.bashrc"
  link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/.zshrc" "$HOME/.zshrc"
  link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/.vimrc" "$HOME/.vimrc"
  link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/.tmux.conf" "$HOME/.tmux.conf"
  
  # Git configuration
  link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/config/git/config" "$HOME/.gitconfig"
  link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/config/git/ignore" "$HOME/.gitignore_global"
  
  # VS Code settings (macOS)
  if [[ "$(uname)" == "Darwin" ]]; then
    local vscode_dir="$HOME/Library/Application Support/Code/User"
    link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/config/vscode/settings.json" "$vscode_dir/settings.json"
    link_dotfile "$DOTFILES_DIR/config/vscode/keybindings.json" "$vscode_dir/keybindings.json"
  fi
}

install_tools() {
  log "Installing development tools..."
  
  if [[ "$(uname)" == "Darwin" ]]; then
    bash "$DOTFILES_DIR/setup/macos.sh"
  elif [[ "$(uname)" == "Linux" ]]; then
    bash "$DOTFILES_DIR/setup/linux.sh"
  fi
}

main() {
  log "Starting dotfiles installation"
  
  install_dotfiles
  install_tools
  
  log "Installation complete!"
  log "Backup created at: $BACKUP_DIR"
  log "Please restart your shell or run: source ~/.bashrc"
}

main "$@"
```

```bash
# ============================================
# FUNCTIONS
# ============================================

# Create directory and cd into it
mkcd() {
  mkdir -p "$1" && cd "$1"
}

# Extract archives
extract() {
  if [ -f "$1" ]; then
    case "$1" in
      *.tar.bz2)   tar xjf "$1"    ;;
      *.tar.gz)    tar xzf "$1"    ;;
      *.bz2)       bunzip2 "$1"    ;;
      *.rar)       unrar x "$1"    ;;
      *.gz)        gunzip "$1"     ;;
      *.tar)       tar xf "$1"     ;;
      *.tbz2)      tar xjf "$1"    ;;
      *.tgz)       tar xzf "$1"    ;;
      *.zip)       unzip "$1"      ;;
      *.Z)         uncompress "$1" ;;
      *.7z)        7z x "$1"       ;;
      *)           echo "'$1' cannot be extracted" ;;
    esac
  else
    echo "'$1' is not a valid file"
  fi
}

# Find process by name
findproc() {
  ps aux | grep -v grep | grep -i -e VSZ -e "$1"
}

# Create a backup of a file
backup() {
  cp "$1" "$1.backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)"
}

# Git commit with conventional commits format
gcc() {
  local type=$1
  shift
  git commit -m "$type: $*"
}

# Quick git add, commit, push
gacp() {
  git add .
  git commit -m "$1"
  git push
}

# Create and checkout a new branch
gcb() {
  git checkout -b "$1"
}

# Docker cleanup
dclean() {
  docker container prune -f
  docker image prune -f
  docker volume prune -f
  docker network prune -f
}

# Find and kill process on port
killport() {
  lsof -ti:"$1" | xargs kill -9
}

# Quick project setup
project() {
  local name=$1
  mkdir -p "$HOME/projects/$name"
  cd "$HOME/projects/$name"
  git init
  echo "# $name" > README.md
  echo "node_modules/\n.env\n.DS_Store" > .gitignore
}

# ============================================
# AUTOCOMPLETIONS
# ============================================

# Enable completion
autoload -Uz compinit
compinit

# Case-insensitive completion
zstyle ':completion:*' matcher-list 'm:{a-zA-Z}={A-Za-z}'

# Menu selection
zstyle ':completion:*' menu select

# Color in completion
zstyle ':completion:*' list-colors ${(s.:.)LS_COLORS}

# ============================================

# ============================================

# Ctrl+Arrow keys for word navigation
bindkey "^[[1;5C" forward-word
bindkey "^[[1;5D" backward-word

# ============================================
# PROMPT CUSTOMIZATION
# ============================================

# Starship prompt (if installed)
if command -v starship &>/dev/null; then
  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
fi

# ============================================
# NODE VERSION MANAGER
# ============================================

# NVM
export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion"

# ============================================
# LOAD CUSTOM SCRIPTS
# ============================================

# Load custom functions and aliases
if [ -d "$HOME/.config/shell" ]; then
  for file in $HOME/.config/shell/*.sh; do
    source "$file"
  done
fi
```

#### 2. Advanced Dev Container with Docker Compose

```yaml
# .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml
version: '3.8'

services:
  app:
    build:
      context: ..
      dockerfile: .devcontainer/Dockerfile
    volumes:
      - ..:/workspace:cached
      - node_modules:/workspace/node_modules
    command: sleep infinity
    network_mode: service:db
    depends_on:
      - db
      - redis
    environment:
      - DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/devdb
      - REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379

  db:
    image: postgres:15-alpine
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - postgres-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: postgres
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
      POSTGRES_DB: devdb

  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - redis-data:/data

volumes:
  postgres-data:
  redis-data:
  node_modules:
```

## Examples

### Example 1: Complete macOS Development Setup Script

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# setup/macos.sh - macOS development environment setup

set -euo pipefail

log() { echo "[$(date +'%H:%M:%S')] $*"; }

# Install Homebrew
install_homebrew() {
  if ! command -v brew &>/dev/null; then
    log "Installing Homebrew..."
    /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
  else
    log "Homebrew already installed"
  fi
}

# Install CLI tools
install_cli_tools() {
  log "Installing CLI tools..."
  
  local tools=(
    git
    node
    python@3.11
    go
    rust
    docker
    docker-compose
    kubectl
    helm
    terraform
    awscli
    gh
    jq
    yq
    tree
    htop
    wget
    curl
    vim
    tmux
    fzf
    ripgrep
    bat
    exa
    starship
  )
  
  brew install "${tools[@]}"
}

# Install applications
install_apps() {
  log "Installing applications..."
  
  local apps=(
    visual-studio-code
    iterm2
    docker
    postman
    slack
    notion
    rectangle
    stats
  )
  
  brew install --cask "${apps[@]}"
}

# Configure Git
configure_git() {
  log "Configuring Git..."
  
  read -p "Enter your Git name: " git_name
  read -p "Enter your Git email: " git_email
  
  git config --global user.name "$git_name"
  git config --global user.email "$git_email"
  git config --global init.defaultBranch main
  git config --global pull.rebase true
  git config --global core.editor "vim"
}

# Install Node.js global packages
install_node_globals() {
  log "Installing Node.js global packages..."
  
  npm install -g \
    typescript \
    ts-node \
    eslint \
    prettier \
    nodemon \
    npm-check-updates \
    serve \
    vercel \
    netlify-cli
}

# Setup directories
setup_directories() {
  log "Creating project directories..."
  
  mkdir -p "$HOME/projects"
  mkdir -p "$HOME/workspace"
  mkdir -p "$HOME/.config"
}

# Configure macOS defaults
configure_macos() {
  log "Configuring macOS defaults..."
  
  # Show hidden files
  defaults write com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles -bool true
  
  # Show file extensions
  defaults write NSGlobalDomain AppleShowAllExtensions -bool true
  
  # Disable .DS_Store on network volumes
  defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteNetworkStores -bool true
  
  # Faster key repeat
  defaults write NSGlobalDomain KeyRepeat -int 2
  defaults write NSGlobalDomain InitialKeyRepeat -int 15
  
  # Screenshot location
  mkdir -p "$HOME/Screenshots"
  defaults write com.apple.screencapture location "$HOME/Screenshots"
  
  # Restart affected apps
  killall Finder
}

main() {
  log "Starting macOS development setup"
  
  install_homebrew
  install_cli_tools
  install_apps
  configure_git
  install_node_globals
  setup_directories
  configure_macos
  
  log "Setup complete! Please restart your terminal."
}

main "$@"
```

### Example 2: Team Development Environment Template

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# team-setup.sh - Standardized team environment setup

set -euo pipefail

PROJECT_NAME="my-app"
NODE_VERSION="18.17.0"
PYTHON_VERSION="3.11.4"

log() { echo "[SETUP] $*"; }
error() { echo "[ERROR] $*" >&2; exit 1; }

# Check prerequisites
check_prerequisites() {
  log "Checking prerequisites..."
  
  command -v git >/dev/null || error "Git is not installed"
  command -v docker >/dev/null || error "Docker is not installed"
  command -v node >/dev/null || error "Node.js is not installed"
  
  local node_ver=$(node -v | cut -d'v' -f2)
  if [[ "$node_ver" != "$NODE_VERSION"* ]]; then
    log "Warning: Expected Node.js v$NODE_VERSION, found v$node_ver"
  fi
}

# Clone repositories
clone_repos() {
  log "Cloning repositories..."
  
  mkdir -p "$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME"
  cd "$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME"
  
  if [[ ! -d "frontend" ]]; then
    git clone git@github.com:org/frontend.git
  fi
  
  if [[ ! -d "backend" ]]; then
    git clone git@github.com:org/backend.git
  fi
}

# Setup frontend
setup_frontend() {
  log "Setting up frontend..."
  
  cd "$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME/frontend"
  
  # Install dependencies
  npm ci
  
  # Copy environment file
  if [[ ! -f ".env.local" ]]; then
    cp .env.example .env.local
    log "Created .env.local - please configure it"
  fi
  
  # Run build to verify setup
  npm run build
}

# Setup backend
setup_backend() {
  log "Setting up backend..."
  
  cd "$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME/backend"
  
  # Install dependencies
  npm ci
  
  # Copy environment file
  if [[ ! -f ".env" ]]; then
    cp .env.example .env
    log "Created .env - please configure it"
  fi
  
  # Start docker services
  docker-compose up -d postgres redis
  
  # Wait for services
  sleep 5
  
  # Run migrations
  npm run db:migrate
  npm run db:seed
}

# Setup git hooks
setup_git_hooks() {
  log "Setting up git hooks..."
  
  cd "$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME/frontend"
  npm run prepare  # Installs husky
  
  cd "$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME/backend"
  npm run prepare
}

# Create helper scripts
create_helper_scripts() {
  log "Creating helper scripts..."
  
  local scripts_dir="$HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME/scripts"
  mkdir -p "$scripts_dir"
  
  cat > "$scripts_dir/dev.sh" <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Start development environment
cd "$(dirname "$0")/.."

tmux new-session -d -s myapp
tmux send-keys -t myapp 'cd backend && npm run dev' C-m
tmux split-window -t myapp -h
tmux send-keys -t myapp 'cd frontend && npm run dev' C-m
tmux attach -t myapp
EOF
  
  chmod +x "$scripts_dir/dev.sh"
  log "Created dev.sh helper script"
}

# Print next steps
print_next_steps() {
  cat <<EOF

=====================================
Setup Complete!
=====================================

Next steps:
1. Configure environment variables:
   - frontend/.env.local
   - backend/.env

2. Start development:
   cd $HOME/workspace/$PROJECT_NAME/scripts
   ./dev.sh

3. Access the application:
   - Frontend: http://localhost:3000
   - Backend:  http://localhost:8000
   - Postgres: localhost:5432
   - Redis:    localhost:6379

Documentation: https://docs.example.com
EOF
}

main() {
  log "Starting team environment setup for $PROJECT_NAME"
  
  check_prerequisites
  clone_repos
  setup_frontend
  setup_backend
  setup_git_hooks
  create_helper_scripts
  print_next_steps
}

main "$@"
```
